Hero.text: Passionate about exploring and learning new things, with a focus on Typescript and React.

items.title: Chef
items.text: Before going into the technology field, I worked as a Chef de Cuisine for a decade, collaborating with exceptional teams and prominent professionals in the field.

items.title: A Few Miles Traveled
items.text: I was born in Rio de Janeiro, but soon moved to Nova Friburgo, in the countryside of the state. Later, in my professional journey, I lived in São Paulo and Lisbon.

items.title: Commitment
items.text: I have a great respect for the work environment and always approach my tasks with interest and collaboration.

text.paragraph: My interest in exploring a new career path was ignited by my passion for solving problems, continuous learning, and developing projects.

I started studying JavaScript slowly to ensure I was making the right decision. By the end of 2022, I chose to participate in the IronHack Web Development BootCamp. Since then, I've been deepening my programming knowledge and practicing extensively.
Certain skills are essential in any field, so I highlight my ability to solve challenges, my dedication, and my capability to meet deadlines.

projects.name: Gourmet Shop
projects.description: I developed an online gourmet product store using Next.js and Typescript. I used Node.js for the server-side and got inspiration from a commercial website for healthy supplements for the project's design.
projects.goals: To develop using a more typed language, become familiar with Next.js using its main tools, and practice Tailwind. I also plan to implement authentication, checkout, shopping cart, and a blog in the project. The challenge included dealing with different layouts for desktop and mobile and using Typescript, which, while helpful in error prevention, also brought typing challenges.
projects.stack: React, Tailwind, TypeScript, Next.js, Node.js, MongoDB

projects.name: Motion Sneakers
projects.description: The challenge included dealing with different layouts for desktop and mobile and using Typescript, which, while helpful in error prevention, also brought typing challenges.
projects.goals: Build an API using Express.js, define models and routes, as well as implement authentication. I also practiced using React to build the Front End and explored the use of Styled Components. All product data is downloaded in a single request, although this approach is not entirely realistic, it allowed me to deepen my knowledge in array manipulation and dealing with multiple filtering challenges.
projects.stack: React, JavaScript, Styled Components, Node.js, MongoDB

projects.name: Angry Match
projects.description: Angry Match is a memory game developed in React, with the use of an image API. This was my first project during the Bootcamp.
projects.goals: Developing skills in React and programming logic was the primary goal, especially in handling game variables such as victory, defeat, points, and card behavior. Programming logic was the greatest challenge, where, due to lack of experience, I made misguided decisions in approaching certain problems.
